main event: A housewife named Mary Saunders observed a silvery-white, circular object hovering in the sky for about 5 minutes in Rockville, Indiana on July 7, 1952.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 50-75 feet in diameter.
The object hovered and made no noise before suddenly disappearing.
The witness called the police, who interviewed her about the sighting.
The object was analyzed as 'unidentified' by the Air Intelligence Officer.
The report also includes a separate sighting of an unidentified triangular-shaped object that was observed by three members of an Air Force unit.
witnesses: Mary Saunders, housewife; three members of an Air Force unit
